summary:
The Umayyad Empire, ruled by the Umayyad family, was the second major Islamic empire. It began with Uthman ibn Affan and was established by Mu'awiya I in 661. The Umayyads ruled from Damascus, Syria, and controlled a huge area, including North Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. They allowed different religions to exist but made non-Muslims pay a special tax.

title: Umayyad Caliphate
